bibl.title: Letter from Mrs. John R. Hall to Howard A. Kelly, July 4, 1907

div1.p: Hall sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Mrs. John R. Hall to Howard A. Kelly, July 4, 1907
div1.opener:
ans
Dr. Howard A. Kelly,
1418 Eutaw Place
Baltimore-
My dear Sir:-
div1.p:
Last winter
I read in The Youth's
Companion, your article
on “The Lesson of Little
Things”

I was so deeply
AC
Ki
touched by the noble
heroism of those you
wrote, that I laid the
paper away, that I might
again read it to the
younger members of
my family-

In a news
paper sketch of “A
Hero in Distress” I
find that Private
John Kissinger
is in great need.
I beg to have the honor of
making a small contribu-
tion towards the support of
one so afflicted and
so worthy.
div1.closer:
Very Sincerely Yours, Mrs. John Randolph Hall. July 4- 1907.
Marshall Missouri-
